newsitem.title: UK: UK meals/feeds firmer but quiet.
newsitem.headline: UK meals/feeds firmer but quiet.

text.p: UK meals and feeds closed without trading but firmer due to currency factors, which countered overnight sharp losses on the new crop Chicago soybean meal futures.
Chicago fell on the back of a high USDA 1997 planted soybean acreage estimate of 68.8 million acres, the highest since 1980 and well above trade expectations for 65.85 million.
However, traders in the UK said that they were now waiting to see what Chicago will do next before taking a stance of their own.
Early forecasts are pointing towards a bounce on the Chicago futures market.
Soybean meal selling levels in the UK posted gains of around four to six sterling per tonne, while rapemeal was mostly around two sterling above last Thursday's finish.
